title: Constructivist-Based Elementary Computational Thinking Development Program

context.prior_knowledge: Basic scientific knowledge and experience with digital tool utilization
context.additional_context: A process integrating computational thinking with science curricula through constructivist activities in smartphone-limited technological environments, emphasizing field-applicable instructional design competencies.

learning_goals: They develop the ability to analyze everyday problems using computational thinking elements (decomposition, pattern recognition, abstraction, algorithm design).
They understand physical-digital interactions by applying unplugged activities to scientific inquiry tasks.
They design and implement learner-centered computational thinking tasks based on constructivist principles.

resources: Unplugged Activity Kit (Algorithm Puzzles, Pattern Cards)
Offline Science Experiment Tools (Simple Circuits, Observation Journals)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
